subject: A Taste of Season Two
event:
HBO gave us all a little taste of season two of GAME OF THRONES tonight, with an "In Production" feature before the latest kickass episode of BOARDWALK EMPIRE.

In case you missed it...

<lj-embed id="231"/>

Lots of our new second season characters can be glimpsed therein... Melisandre, Stannis, Davos, Brienne, Margaery, and so many more... 

You'll meet them all in April.

comments.article: It looks absolutely fantastic. Breath-taking! So excited about the new season, April can't come fast enough!
Agree! ^^ It looks way too awesome, right?
time to hibernate 'till April!
That's Okay, Jon becomes a man through this season (and into next) as does Robb, so it will be fitting for the actors to mature also.

Looks like it'll be another incredible season! I still can't believe I'm getting an HBO show AND A Dance with Dragons came out, and that it was my favorite book of the series! Life just keeps getting better and better.
Yay! New character icon time!
Have you heard anything about when the first trailer is coming?
comments.subject: Trailer

comments.article:
Cool.

So, does this mean they're sticking with "Game Of Thrones" as the title for the whole Song Of Ice And Fire?

(coincidentally, I'm rereading the first book now, and can't get Sean Bean's voice out of my head...)
All I will say is that I can't wait!
Oh, I can't barely wait for April to come! I've watched this three times in a round, and I can't still get enough of the few glipses at the new season that it shows! *O*
Can't wait!! I watched it 3 times and tried to find Brienne... can anyone tell me the timestamp when she appears??
She appears in the background at 1:46.
comments.subject: Brienne

comments.article: Love! Can't wait to see it in 2012!

comments.upictitle: ♔ Lydzi ♔ Au service du Roi Rickon.: Sunny Baudelaire
comments.article: April can't come faster enough now!! Stannis! Davos! Renly and his crown! Melisandre! Sansa! jhfsgdgf

I think she's the one behind Renly...
http://30.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_luznpdpPQo1qfv91lo3_250.gif

LOL'ing at Jon Snow's tan! The poor kid just HAD to come to Cali, didn't he? Haha.

Everything looks great. Though we didn't get a good enough look at Brienne and Mel. Eurgh, you teases!
So excited, can't wait! (And I'm in NZ, so I'll have to wait even longer!) ...
George, have you seen the Best Buy commercial that has A Dance of Dragon featured prominently on a Kindle? So awesome!! I'm so happy for your success!
comments.subject: You know you're a big deal...

comments.article: Good luck with next book George. It is one of the best book I've ever read. Movie is very good as well, but the book is soooo much better.
Any idea who's the blonde behind Cat?
based on the crowned stag banner in the background, Cat's at Renly's camp, so my guess is that's Loras behind her...
Looking good... :)
Been on the set in Dubrovnik, Croatia. Costumes are grand!!!

Mr. Martin, this probably isn't the best place to post this, but I thought you might like to see this:

That is f**king awesome!

1:21 who is he? the one that is with Theon


can´t wait!!!
should be Aeron Damphair, no?

Natalie Dormer, Natalie Dormer, Natalie Dormer *happy dance*

Under the sea, The Flowers eat the Lions and Natalie Dormer is in my wet dreams. I know, I know, oh, oh, oh.
comments.subject: Natalie Dormer

comments.article:
Hello George and rest of the people here,
I am new to the books(recently read all five). What I cannot figure out is this- What is the basis of years in westeros? Years were introduced as a unit of time based on when the seasons recurred, in civilizations of old. What is the basis of years in westeros? Was there a time in history of westeros when seasons repeated yearly?
I don't know if this is the right place to ask this question, I am sorry if it is not.
comments.subject: Seasons and years

comments.article: Years were NOT based on seasons, actually.  They were based on astronomonical observations, the positions of the stars in the sky.  It's the same in Westeros.
comments.subject: Re: Seasons and years
